library.name: Mitre-D3fend
library.desc: Quick and dirty ingestion of the mitre defend technique tree from https://d3fend.mitre.org/resources

countermeasure.name: Active Certificate Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Actively collecting PKI certificates by connecting to the server and downloading its server certificates for analysis.

countermeasure.name: Application Configuration Hardening
countermeasure.desc: Modifying an application's configuration to reduce its attack surface.

countermeasure.name: Account Locking
countermeasure.desc: The process of temporarily disabling user accounts on a system or domain.

countermeasure.name: Authentication Cache Invalidation
countermeasure.desc: Removing tokens or credentials from an authentication cache to prevent further user associated account accesses.

countermeasure.name: Authentication Event Thresholding
countermeasure.desc: Collecting authentication events, creating a baseline user profile, and determining whether authentication events are consistent with the baseline profile.

countermeasure.name: Authorization Event Thresholding
countermeasure.desc: Collecting authorization events, creating a baseline user profile, and determining whether authorization events are consistent with the baseline profile.

countermeasure.name: Bootloader Authentication
countermeasure.desc: Cryptographically authenticating the bootloader software before system boot.

countermeasure.name: Biometric Authenication
countermeasure.desc: Using biological measures in order to authenticate a user.

countermeasure.name: Broadcast Domain Isolation
countermeasure.desc: Broadcast isolation restricts the number of computers a host can contact on their LAN.

countermeasure.name: Byte Sequence Emulation
countermeasure.desc: Analyzing sequences of bytes and determining if they likely represent malicious shellcode.

countermeasure.name: Certificate Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Detection of unauthorized use of administrative network protocols by analyzing network activity against a baseline.

countermeasure.name: Connection Attempt Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Analyzing failed connections in a network to detect unauthorized activity.

countermeasure.name: Certificate-based Authentication
countermeasure.desc: Requiring a digital certificate in order to authenticate a user.

countermeasure.name: Credential Compromise Scope Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Determining which credentials may have been compromised by analyzing the user logon history of a particular system.

countermeasure.name: Connected Honeynet
countermeasure.desc: A decoy service, system, or environment, that is connected to the enterprise network, and simulates or emulates certain functionality to the network, without exposing full access to a production system.

countermeasure.name: Certificate Pinning
countermeasure.desc: Persisting either a server's X509 certificate or their public key and comparing that to server's presented identity to allow for greater client confidence in the remote server's identity for SSL connections.

countermeasure.name: Client-server Payload Profiling
countermeasure.desc: Comparing client-server request and response payloads to a baseline profile to identify outliers.

countermeasure.name: Credential Transmission Scoping
countermeasure.desc: Limiting the transmission of a credential to a scoped set of relying parties.

countermeasure.name: Dynamic Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Executing or opening a file in a synthetic "sandbox" environment to determine if the file is a malicious program or if the file exploits another program such as a document reader.

countermeasure.name: Domain Account Monitoring
countermeasure.desc: Monitoring the existence of or changes to Domain User Accounts.

countermeasure.name: Dead Code Elimination
countermeasure.desc: Removing unreachable or "dead code" from compiled source code.

countermeasure.name: Disk Encryption
countermeasure.desc: Encrypting a hard disk partition to prevent cleartext access to a file system.

countermeasure.name: Driver Load Integrity Checking
countermeasure.desc: Ensuring the integrity of drivers loaded during initialization of the operating system.

countermeasure.name: Decoy File
countermeasure.desc: A file created for the purposes of deceiving an adversary.

countermeasure.name: Decoy Network Resource
countermeasure.desc: Deploying a network resource for the purposes of deceiving an adversary.

countermeasure.name: DNS Allowlisting
countermeasure.desc: Permitting only approved domains and their subdomains to be resolved.

countermeasure.name: DNS Traffic Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Analysis of domain name metadata, including name and DNS records, to determine whether the domain is likely to resolve to an undesirable host.

countermeasure.name: Decoy Persona
countermeasure.desc: Establishing a fake online identity to misdirect, deceive, and or interact with adversaries.

countermeasure.name: Decoy Public Release
countermeasure.desc: Issuing publicly released media to deceive adversaries.

countermeasure.name: Database Query String Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Analyzing database queries to detect [SQL Injection](https://capec.mitre.org/data/definitions/66.html).

countermeasure.name: Decoy Session Token
countermeasure.desc: An authentication token created for the purposes of deceiving an adversary.

countermeasure.name: Outbound Traffic Filtering
countermeasure.desc: Restricting network traffic originating from a private host or enclave destined towards untrusted networks.

countermeasure.name: Domain Trust Policy
countermeasure.desc: Restricting inter-domain trust by modifying domain configuration.

countermeasure.name: Decoy User Credential
countermeasure.desc: A Credential created for the purpose of deceiving an adversary.

countermeasure.name: Executable Allowlisting
countermeasure.desc: Using a digital signature to authenticate a file before opening.

countermeasure.name: Executable Denylisting
countermeasure.desc: Blocking the execution of files on a host in accordance with defined application policy rules.

countermeasure.name: Emulated File Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Emulating instructions in a file looking for specific patterns.

countermeasure.name: Endpoint Health Beacon
countermeasure.desc: Monitoring the security status of an endpoint by sending periodic messages with health status, where absence of a response may indicate that the endpoint has been compromised.

countermeasure.name: Exception Handler Pointer Validation
countermeasure.desc: Validates that a referenced exception handler pointer is a valid exception handler.

countermeasure.name: Encrypted Tunnels
countermeasure.desc: Encrypted encapsulation of routable network traffic.

countermeasure.name: File Access Pattern Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Analyzing the files accessed by a process to identify unauthorized activity.

countermeasure.name: Firmware Behavior Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Analyzing the behavior of embedded code in firmware and looking for anomalous behavior and suspicious activity.

countermeasure.name: File Carving
countermeasure.desc: Identifying and extracting files from network application protocols through the use of network stream reassembly software.

countermeasure.name: File Content Rules
countermeasure.desc: Employing a pattern matching rule language to analyze files.

countermeasure.name: File Encryption
countermeasure.desc: Encrypting a file using a cryptographic key.

countermeasure.name: Firmware Embedded Monitoring Code
countermeasure.desc: Monitoring code is injected into firmware for integrity monitoring of firmware and firmware data.

countermeasure.name: File Hashing
countermeasure.desc: Employing file hash comparisons to detect known malware.

countermeasure.name: Hierarchical Domain Denylisting
countermeasure.desc: Blocking the resolution of any subdomain of a specified domain name.

countermeasure.name: Forward Resolution IP Denylisting
countermeasure.desc: Blocking a DNS lookup's answer's IP address value.

countermeasure.name: Hardware-based Process Isolation
countermeasure.desc: Preventing one process from writing to the memory space of another process through hardware based address manager implementations.

countermeasure.name: Homoglyph Detection
countermeasure.desc: Comparing strings using a variety of techniques to determine if a deceptive or malicious string is being presented to a user.

countermeasure.name: Homoglyph Denylisting
countermeasure.desc: Blocking DNS queries that are deceptively similar to legitimate domain names.

countermeasure.name: Indirect Branch Call Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Analyzing vendor specific branch call recording in order to detect ROP style attacks.

countermeasure.name: Input Device Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Operating system level mechanisms to prevent abusive input device exploitation.

countermeasure.name: Integrated Honeynet
countermeasure.desc: The practice of setting decoys in a production environment to entice interaction from attackers.

countermeasure.name: IPC Traffic Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Analyzing standard inter process communication (IPC) protocols to detect deviations from normal protocol activity.

countermeasure.name: IO Port Restriction
countermeasure.desc: Limiting access to computer input/output (IO) ports to restrict unauthorized devices.

countermeasure.name: Inbound Session Volume Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Analyzing inbound network session or connection attempt volume.

countermeasure.name: Inbound Traffic Filtering
countermeasure.desc: Restricting network traffic originating from untrusted networks destined towards a private host or enclave.

countermeasure.name: Job Function Access Pattern Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Detecting anomalies in user access patterns by comparing user access activity to behavioral profiles that categorize users by role such as job title, function, department.

countermeasure.name: Local Account Monitoring
countermeasure.desc: Analyzing local user accounts to detect unauthorized activity.

countermeasure.name: Local File Permissions
countermeasure.desc: Restricting access to a local file by configuring operating system functionality.

countermeasure.name: Mandatory Access Control
countermeasure.desc: Controlling access to local computer system resources with kernel-level capabilities.

countermeasure.name: Message Authentication
countermeasure.desc: Authenticating the sender of a message and ensuring message integrity.

countermeasure.name: Memory Boundary Tracking
countermeasure.desc: Analyzing a call stack for return addresses which point to unexpected  memory locations.

countermeasure.name: Message Encryption
countermeasure.desc: Encrypting a message body using a cryptographic key.

countermeasure.name: Multi-factor Authentication
countermeasure.desc: Requiring proof of two or more pieces of evidence in order to authenticate a user.

countermeasure.name: Network Traffic Community Deviation
countermeasure.desc: Establishing baseline communities of network hosts and identifying statistically divergent inter-community communication.

countermeasure.name: One-time Password
countermeasure.desc: A one-time password is valid for only one user authentication.

countermeasure.name: Pointer Authentication
countermeasure.desc: Comparing the cryptographic hash or derivative of a pointer's value to an expected value.

countermeasure.name: Passive Certificate Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Collecting host certificates from network traffic or other passive sources like a certificate transparency log and analyzing them for unauthorized activity.

countermeasure.name: Process Code Segment Verification
countermeasure.desc: Comparing the "text" or "code" memory segments to a source of truth.

countermeasure.name: Peripheral Firmware Verification
countermeasure.desc: Cryptographically verifying peripheral firmware integrity.

countermeasure.name: Per Host Download-Upload Ratio Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Detecting anomalies that indicate malicious activity by comparing the amount of data downloaded versus data uploaded by a host.

countermeasure.name: Process Lineage Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Identification of suspicious processes executing on an end-point device by examining the ancestry and siblings of a process, and the associated metadata of each node on the tree, such as process execution, duration, and order relative to siblings and ancestors.

countermeasure.name: Protocol Metadata Anomaly Detection
countermeasure.desc: Collecting network communication protocol metadata and identifying statistical outliers.

countermeasure.name: Process Segment Execution Prevention
countermeasure.desc: Preventing execution of any address in a memory region other than the code segment.

countermeasure.name: Process Self-Modification Detection
countermeasure.desc: Detects processes that modify, change, or replace their own code at runtime.

countermeasure.name: Process Termination
countermeasure.desc: Terminating a running application process on a computer system.

countermeasure.name: Resource Access Pattern Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Analyzing the resources accessed by a user to identify unauthorized activity.

countermeasure.name: RF Shielding
countermeasure.desc: Adding physical barriers to a platform to prevent undesired radio interference.

countermeasure.name: Relay Pattern Analysis
countermeasure.desc: The detection of an internal host relaying traffic between the internal network and the external network.

countermeasure.name: Reverse Resolution Domain Denylisting
countermeasure.desc: Blocking a reverse DNS lookup's answer's domain name value.

countermeasure.name: Reverse Resolution IP Denylisting
countermeasure.desc: Blocking a reverse lookup based on the query's IP address value.

countermeasure.name: RPC Traffic Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Monitoring the activity of remote procedure calls in communication traffic to establish standard protocol operations and potential attacker activities.

countermeasure.name: Remote Terminal Session Detection
countermeasure.desc: Detection of an unauthorized remote live terminal console session by examining network traffic to a network host.

countermeasure.name: Segment Address Offset Randomization
countermeasure.desc: Randomizing the base (start) address of one or more segments of memory during the initialization of a process.

countermeasure.name: Service Binary Verification
countermeasure.desc: Analyzing changes in service binary files by comparing to a source of truth.

countermeasure.name: System Call Filtering
countermeasure.desc: Configuring a kernel to use an allow or deny list to filter kernel api calls.

countermeasure.name: System Configuration Permissions
countermeasure.desc: Restricting system configuration modifications to a specific user or group of users.

countermeasure.name: Session Duration Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Analyzing the duration of user sessions in order to detect unauthorized  activity.

countermeasure.name: System Daemon Monitoring
countermeasure.desc: Tracking changes to the state or configuration of critical system level processes.

countermeasure.name: Script Execution Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Analyzing the execution of a script to detect unauthorized user activity.

countermeasure.name: Stack Frame Canary Validation
countermeasure.desc: Comparing a value stored in a stack frame with a known good value in order to prevent or detect a memory segment overwrite.

countermeasure.name: System Firmware Verification
countermeasure.desc: Cryptographically verifying installed system firmware integrity.

countermeasure.name: Standalone Honeynet
countermeasure.desc: An environment created for the purpose of attracting attackers and eliciting their behaviors that is not connected to any production enterprise systems.

countermeasure.name: System Init Config Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Analysis of any system process startup configuration.

countermeasure.name: Scheduled Job Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Analysis of source files, processes, destination files, or destination servers associated with a scheduled job to detect unauthorized use of job scheduling.

countermeasure.name: Sender MTA Reputation Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Characterizing the reputation of mail transfer agents (MTA) to determine the security risk in emails.

countermeasure.name: Strong Password Policy
countermeasure.desc: Modifying system configuration to increase password strength.

countermeasure.name: Sender Reputation Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Ascertaining sender reputation based on information associated with a message (e.g. email/instant messaging).

countermeasure.name: Shadow Stack Comparisons
countermeasure.desc: Comparing a call stack in system memory with a shadow call stack maintained by the processor to determine unauthorized shellcode activity.

countermeasure.name: Software Update
countermeasure.desc: Replacing old software on a computer system component.

countermeasure.name: Transfer Agent Authentication
countermeasure.desc: Validating that server components of a messaging infrastructure are authorized to send a particular message.

countermeasure.name: TPM Boot Integrity
countermeasure.desc: Assuring the integrity of a platform by demonstrating that the boot process starts from a trusted combination of hardware and software and continues until the operating system has fully booted and applications are running.  Sometimes called Static Root of Trust Measurement (STRM).

countermeasure.name: URL Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Determining if a URL is benign or malicious by analyzing the URL or its components.

countermeasure.name: User Account Permissions
countermeasure.desc: Restricting a user account's access to resources.

countermeasure.name: User Data Transfer Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Analyzing the amount of data transferred by a user.

countermeasure.name: User Geolocation Logon Pattern Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Monitoring geolocation data of user logon attempts and comparing it to a baseline user behavior profile to identify anomalies in logon location.

countermeasure.name: User Session Init Config Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Analyzing modifications to user session config files such as .bashrc or .bash_profile.

countermeasure.name: Web Session Activity Analysis
countermeasure.desc: Monitoring changes in user web session behavior by comparing current web session activity to a baseline behavior profile or a catalog of predetermined malicious behavior.
